page.title: 12GLADESTRY SCHOOL
page.content: The school was built in 1877. The land was given by Lord Ormathwaite to build a school for the children of the labouring classes. There was one large room, divided by a curtain. The toilets were outside. The children went to school from 5 to 14 years old. Some children went to the Grammar School when they were 11. There is a new infant room now, and a new kitchen, library, and toilets. The old porch is the headteacher's office. Now there are 12 children using the big room, once used for 60 children. Now there are electric radiators instead of coal fires. There are carpets, wall-boards, some new furniture, and a computer. Children now start school at the age of 4, and at 11 they go to John Beddoes School at Presteigne. There are 27 children in school, and a lot of young ones to come.
